## density plots

EDS, NOT_EDS, BLCK, HISP, WHTE  
for MA and RD grouped by year  

```{r echo=FALSE}
fn_knit_exit("fn_plt_glp_density_year")
```

```{r fn_plt_glp_density_year}
fn_plt_glp_density_year <- function() {
  df1_ <- dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>%
  dplyr::select(
    subject,
    grade,
    subgroup,
    num_tested,
    num_glp,
    pct_glp,
    acYear,
    charter_school,
    TitleISchool
  ) %>%
  dplyr::filter(
    subgroup %in% c("EDS","NOT_EDS","BLCK","HISP","WHTE")
  ) %>%
  na.omit() %>%
  dplyr::group_by(
    subject,
    grade,
    subgroup,
    acYear
  )
  #
  ret <- list()
  iret_ <- 0
  for (S_ in c("MA","RD")) {
    for (G_ in c("03","04","05")) {
      for (SG_ in c("EDS","NOT_EDS","BLCK","HISP","WHTE")) {
        #
        plt_ <-
        df1_ %>%
          dplyr::filter(
            subject==S_ &
            grade==G_ &
            subgroup==SG_
          ) %>%
        ggplot(
          aes( 
            x=pct_glp,
            fill=acYear
          )
        ) +
        geom_density(
          alpha=0.3
        ) +
        labs(
          title=paste(S_,"for Grade",G_,"  Group",SG_)
        )
      iret_ <- iret_+1
      ret[[iret_]] <- plt_
      }
    }
  }  
  return(ret)
}
```  

## Consider GLP% as related to race and the racial composition of schools  

Look at 2016-17 only for this preliminary analysis.  
Use dfDisagX20_Yr and dfDisagSubgroupsC (<- for 2016-17 only)  

### What is the distribution of GLP% scores for black children?  

Generate helper dataframes that hold schools with more Whites than Blacks:  
```{r echo=FALSE}
fn_knit_exit("fn_dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D")
fn_knit_exit("dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D")
```

```{r fn_dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D}
fn_dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D <- function() {
  return(
  	dfDisagX20_Yr %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		f_acYear=="D" & 
  		subgroup %in% c("WHTE","BLCK") 
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code,
  		subgroup,
  		num_tested
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::group_by(
  		LEA,
  		school_code,
  		subgroup
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::summarize(
  		num_total=sum(num_tested)
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::ungroup() %>%
  	tidyr::spread(
  		subgroup,
  		num_total
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		!is.na(BLCK) & 
  		!is.na(WHTE) &
  		WHTE > BLCK
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code
  	)
  )
}
#
str(fn_dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D())
dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D <- fn_dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D()
```

```{r functions_1}
# 
# Functions to generate quintiles:
#
fn_q345BLCK <- function(x,y) {
	quantile(
		dfDisag345BLCK_D %>%
		dplyr::filter(
			subject==y &
			grade==x
		) %>%
		dplyr::select(
			pct_glp
		) %>%
		unlist(
			use.names=FALSE
		),
		probs=seq(0,1,0.2)
		)
}
#
# Do same for WHTE
#
fn_q345WHTE <- function(x,y) {
	quantile(
		dfDisag345WHTE_D %>%
		dplyr::filter(
			subject==y &
			grade==x
		) %>%
		dplyr::select(
			pct_glp
		) %>%
		unlist(
			use.names=FALSE
		),
		probs=seq(0,1,0.2)
		)
}
```  

### "Best schools" ad hoc definition  

Suppose we select 75% WHTE GLP% for ALL three grades and BOTH subjects as the lower bound for "best" schools
and also require a higher % of White than Black students.  
Which schools are they?  
```{r echo=FALSE}
fn_knit_exit("fn_dfDisagBest345WHTE_D")
fn_knit_exit("dfDisagBest345WHTE_D")
```  

```{r fn_dfDisagBest345WHTE_D}
fn_dfDisagBest345WHTE_D <- function() {
  return(
  	dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		f_acYear=="D" & 
  		subgroup=="WHTE" &
  		pct_glp >= 75
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code,
  		subject,
  		grade,
  		num_tested,
  		pct_glp,
  		charter_school,
  		TitleISchool
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::group_by(
  		LEA,
  		school_code
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		n()==6
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::ungroup() %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::distinct() %>%
  	dplyr::inner_join(
  		dfDisag345moreWHTE_D,
  		by=c("LEA","school_code")
  	)
  )
}
```  

```{r fn_dfDisagBLCK_best345_WHTE_GLP_D}
fn_dfDisagBLCK_best345_WHTE_GLP_D <- function() {
  # this is just an intermediate dataframe:
  # MA and RD will be the same for dfTmp1
  dfTmp1 <- dfDisagBest345WHTE_D %>%
  	dplyr::inner_join(
  		dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>%
  		dplyr::filter(
  			f_acYear=="D" &
  			subject=="MA" &
  			subgroup %in% c("ALL","BLCK","WHTE")
  		),
  		by=c("LEA","school_code")
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code,
  		subgroup,
  		num_tested,
  		charter_school,
  		TitleISchool
  	)  %>%
    dplyr::mutate_all(
      funs(ifelse(is.na(.), 0, .))
    ) %>%
  	reshape2::dcast(
  		LEA+school_code+charter_school+TitleISchool~subgroup,
  		sum,
  		value.var="num_tested"
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		BLCK>0
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::mutate(
  		pct_num_BLCK=round(BLCK*100/ALL,digits=1),
  		pct_num_WHTE=round(WHTE*100/ALL,digits=1)
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::rename(
  		num_BLCK=BLCK,
  		num_WHTE=WHTE
  	)
  #
  # another intermediate dataframe:
  dfTmp2 <- dfDisagBest345WHTE_D %>%
  	dplyr::inner_join(
  		dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>%
  		dplyr::filter(
  			f_acYear=="D" &
  			subgroup %in% c("ALL","BLCK","WHTE")
  		),
  		by=c("LEA","school_code")
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		school_code,
  		subject,
  		subgroup,
  		num_glp,
  	) %>%
    dplyr::mutate_all(
      funs(ifelse(is.na(.), 0, .))
    ) %>%
  	reshape2::dcast(
  		school_code+subject~subgroup,
  		sum,
  		value.var="num_glp"
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::rename(
  		glp_ALL=ALL,
  		glp_WHTE=WHTE,
  		glp_BLCK=BLCK
  	)
  #
  dfDisagBLCK_best345_WHTE_GLP_D <- dplyr::inner_join(
  	dfTmp1,
  	dfTmp2,
  	by="school_code"
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::mutate(
  		pct_glp_WHTE=round(glp_WHTE*100/num_WHTE,digits=1),
  		pct_glp_BLCK=round(glp_BLCK*100/num_BLCK,digits=1)
  	)
  #
  return(dfDisagBLCK_best345_WHTE_GLP_D)
}
#
str(fn_dfDisagBLCK_best345_WHTE_GLP_D())
dfDisagBLCK_best345_WHTE_GLP_D <- fn_dfDisagBLCK_best345_WHTE_GLP_D()
  ```  

```{r fn_dfDisagEDS_345_NOT_EDS_GLP_D}
fn_dfDisagEDS_345_NOT_EDS_GLP_D <- function() {
  # this is just an intermediate dataframe:
  # MA and RD will be the same for dfTmp1
  dfTmp1 <- 
  	dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		f_acYear=="D" &
  		subject=="MA" &
  		subgroup %in% c("ALL","EDS","NOT_EDS")
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code,
  		subgroup,
  		num_tested,
  		charter_school,
  		TitleISchool
  	) %>%
    dplyr::mutate_all(
      funs(ifelse(is.na(.), 0, .))
    ) %>%
  	reshape2::dcast(
  		LEA+school_code+charter_school+TitleISchool~subgroup,
  		sum,
  		value.var="num_tested"
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		EDS>0 &
      NOT_EDS>0
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::mutate(
  		pct_num_EDS=round(EDS*100/ALL,digits=1),
  		pct_num_NOT_EDS=round(NOT_EDS*100/ALL,digits=1)
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::rename(
  		num_EDS=EDS,
  		num_NOT_EDS=NOT_EDS
  	)
  #
  # another intermediate dataframe:
  dfTmp2 <- 
  	dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		f_acYear=="D" &
  		subgroup %in% c("ALL","EDS","NOT_EDS")
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		school_code,
  		subject,
  		subgroup,
  		num_glp,
  	)  %>%

      funs(ifelse(is.na(.), 0, .))
    ) %>%
  	reshape2::dcast(
  		school_code+subject~subgroup,
  		sum,
  		value.var="num_glp"
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::rename(
  		glp_ALL=ALL,
  		glp_EDS=EDS,
  		glp_NOT_EDS=NOT_EDS
  	)
  #
  dfDisagEDS_345_NOT_EDS_GLP_D <- 
  	dplyr::inner_join(
  		dfTmp1,
  		dfTmp2,
  		by="school_code"
  		) %>%
  		dplyr::mutate(
  			pct_glp_EDS=round(glp_EDS*100/num_EDS,digits=1),
  			pct_glp_NOT_EDS=round(glp_NOT_EDS*100/num_NOT_EDS,digits=1)

  #

}
```  

```{r fn_plotly_dfDisagEDS_345_NOT_EDS_GLP_D}
fn_plotly_dfDisagEDS_345_NOT_EDS_GLP_D <- function() {
  dfTmp_ <- 
	dfDisagEDS_345_NOT_EDS_GLP_D %>%
	dplyr::select(
		school_code,
    num_EDS,
    num_NOT_EDS,
		pct_glp_EDS,
		pct_glp_NOT_EDS,
		TitleISchool,
		charter_school,
		subject
	) %>% 
	dplyr::filter(
		subject=="RD"
	) %>%
	dplyr::mutate(
		pl_symbol=ifelse(charter_school,2,1),
		pl_color=ifelse(TitleISchool,2,1)
	) %>%
	na.omit()
  #
  n_schools <- length(unique(dfTmp_$school_code))
	#
	# colors:
	pl_plot_pal <- c("red","blue")
	#
  plt_ <- 
  dfTmp_ %>%
	plot_ly(
		type="scatter",
		mode="markers",
		hoverinfo="text",
		x=~pct_glp_NOT_EDS,
		y=~pct_glp_EDS,
		symbol=~pl_symbol,
		color=~pl_color,
		colors=pl_plot_pal,
		text=~paste0(school_code,"\n#EDS=",num_EDS,"\n#not EDS=",num_NOT_EDS)
	) %>%
	hide_colorbar() %>%
	plotly::layout(
		title="2016-17 Grades 3-5 RD Cumulative GLP% for EDS and Not-EDS Students",
		xaxis=list(range=c(0,100),title="GLP% for Not-EDS Students"),
		yaxis=list(range=c(0,100),title="GLP% for EDS Students"),
		shapes=list(
			type="line",
			x0=0,
			x1=100,
			y0=0,
			y1=100,
			line=list(width=1),
			dash="dot"
		)
	) %>%
	plotly::add_annotations(
		x=20,
		y=95,
		text=paste0(
      n_schools," Schools\n",
      "Blue: Title I Schools\n",
      "Triangles: Charters"
    ),
		showarrow=FALSE
	)
  #
  return(plt_)
}
```  

### Now look at all grades  

WHTE and BLCK proportion at school, all grades (not just 3,4,5).  
Exclude if not BLCK and WHTE at school.  

First, what is the distribution of GLP% across all grades for WHTE?  
(selecting only 2015-16 gives almost the same result)  

Using 75% as cutoff and having more Whites than Blacks,  
Select the "best" schools in 2016-17.  
```{r echo=FALSE}
fn_knit_exit("fn_dfDisagBestWHTE_D")
fn_knit_exit("dfDisagBestWHTE_D")
```  

```{r fn_dfDisagBestWHTE_D}
fn_dfDisagBestWHTE_D <- function() {
  return(
  	dfDisagX20_Yr %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		f_acYear=="D" & 
  		subgroup=="WHTE" &
  		subject=="ALL" &
  		grade=="ALL" &
  		pct_glp >= 75
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code,
  		subject,
  		grade,
  		num_tested,
  		pct_glp,
  		charter_school,
  		TitleISchool
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::inner_join(
  		dfDisagALLmoreWHTE_D,
  		by=c("LEA","school_code")
  	)
  )
}
```  

```{r fn_dfDisagBLCK_best_WHTE_GLP_D}
fn_dfDisagBLCK_best_WHTE_GLP_D <- function() {
  # this is just an intermediate dataframe:
  dfDisagBLCK_best_WHTE_D <-
  	dfDisagX20_Yr %>%
  	dplyr::filter(
  		f_acYear=="D" &
  		grade=="ALL" &
  		subject=="ALL" &
  		subgroup %in% c("ALL","BLCK","WHTE")
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		school_code,
  		subgroup,
  		num_tested
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::inner_join(
  		dfDisagBestWHTE_D %>% 
  			dplyr::select(LEA,school_code),
  		by="school_code"
  	) %>%
  	tidyr::spread(
  		subgroup,
  		num_tested
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::mutate(
  		pct_num_BLCK=round(BLCK*100/ALL,digits=1),
  		pct_num_WHTE=round(WHTE*100/ALL,digits=1)
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		-BLCK,
  		-WHTE
  	)
  #
  # now paste back together to get GLP% for 2016-17
  #
  dfDisagBLCK_best_WHTE_GLP_D <-
  	dplyr::inner_join(
  		dfDisagBLCK_best_WHTE_D %>%
  			dplyr::select(
  				school_code,
  				ALL,
  				pct_num_BLCK,
  				pct_num_WHTE
  			),
  		dfDisagX20_Yr %>% 
  			dplyr::filter(
  				f_acYear=="D" &
  				grade=="ALL" &
  				subject=="ALL" &
  				subgroup %in% c("BLCK","WHTE")
  			),
  		by="school_code"
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::select(
  		LEA,
  		school_code,
  		ALL,
  		pct_num_BLCK,
  		pct_num_WHTE,
  		subgroup,
  		pct_glp
  	) %>%
  	tidyr::spread(
  		subgroup,
  		pct_glp
  	) %>%
  	dplyr::rename(
  		num_tested=ALL,
  		pct_glp_BLCK=BLCK,
  		pct_glp_WHTE=WHTE
  	)
  #
  return(dfDisagBLCK_best_WHTE_GLP_D)
}
```  

#### Functions to get mean and confidence interval.

```{r fn.boot.mean}
fn.boot.mean = function(x,B,binwidth=NULL) {
# Bret Larget
# http://www.stat.wisc.edu/~larget/stat302/chap3.pdf
# A quick bootstrap function for a confidence interval for the mean
# x is a single quantitative sample
# B is the desired number of bootstrap samples to take
# binwidth is passed on to geom_histogram()
	n = length(x)
	boot.samples = matrix( sample(x,size=n*B,replace=TRUE), B, n)
	boot.statistics = apply(boot.samples,1,mean)
	se = sd(boot.statistics)
	#
	if ( is.null(binwidth) )
	binwidth = diff(range(boot.statistics))/30
	p = ggplot(data.frame(x=boot.statistics),aes(x=x)) +
	geom_histogram(aes(y=..density..),binwidth=binwidth) + 
	geom_density(color="red")
	plot(p)
	interval = mean(x) + c(-1,1)*2*se
	print( interval )
  #
	return( 
	  list(
		  boot.statistics = boot.statistics, 
		  interval=interval, 
		  se=se, 
		  plot=p
      ) 
	)
}
```  

```{r fn_pltDisagBLCK_345_WHTE_GLP_D}
  	) +
  	scale_shape_discrete(
  		name="Charter",
  		labels=c("No","Yes")
  	) +
  	theme(
  		plot.title=element_text(

  			face="plain"
  		)
  	) +
  	theme(
  		plot.subtitle=element_text(

  			face="plain"
  		)

  	) +
  	xlim(0,100) +
  	ylim(0,100) +

}
```  

```{r fn_dfDisagX20_345_EDS_best}
fn_dfDisagX20_345_EDS_best <- function(){
  df_ <- 
  dplyr::inner_join(
    dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>% 
    dplyr::filter(
      subgroup=="EDS" & 
      pct_glp>75
    ) %>% 
    dplyr::select(
      acYear,
      LEA,
      school_code,
      subject,
      grade,
      num_tested,
      num_glp,
      pct_glp,
      charter_school,
      TitleISchool
    ),
    dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>% 
    dplyr::filter(
      subgroup=="NOT_EDS"
    ) %>%
    dplyr::select(
      acYear,
      school_code,
      subject,
      grade,
      num_tested,
      num_glp,
      pct_glp
    ),
    by=c(
      "acYear",
      "school_code",
      "subject",
      "grade"
    )
  ) %>%
  dplyr::rename(
    num_tested_EDS=num_tested.x,
    num_tested_NOT_EDS=num_tested.y,
    num_glp_EDS=num_glp.x,
    num_glp_NOT_EDS=num_glp.y,
    pct_glp_EDS=pct_glp.x,
    pct_glp_NOT_EDS=pct_glp.y
  ) %>%
  dplyr::select(
    acYear,
    LEA,
    school_code,
    subject,
    grade,
    num_tested_EDS,
    num_glp_EDS,
    pct_glp_EDS,
    num_tested_NOT_EDS,
    num_glp_NOT_EDS,
    pct_glp_NOT_EDS,    
    charter_school,
    TitleISchool
  ) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    pct_EDS=round(num_tested_EDS*100/(num_tested_EDS+num_tested_NOT_EDS),digits=1)
  ) %>%
  dplyr::select(
    acYear,
    LEA,
    school_code,
    subject,
    grade,
    num_tested_EDS,
    pct_EDS,
    num_glp_EDS,
    pct_glp_EDS,
    num_tested_NOT_EDS,
    num_glp_NOT_EDS,
    pct_glp_NOT_EDS,    
    charter_school,
    TitleISchool
  )
  #
  return(df_)
}
```  

```{r fn_dfDisagX20_345_best_X}
fn_dfDisagX20_345_best_X <- function(argYear) {
## identify schools with BLCK or HISP GLP% > 75 over grades 3, 4 and 5
## selected for one year
  if (!(argYear %in% LETTERS[1:4])) {
    stop("argYears must be in A through D.")
  }  
  theYear <- forYears[which(LETTERS==argYear)]
  #
  return(
    dfDisagX20_345_Yr %>%
    dplyr::filter(
      subgroup %in% c("BLCK","HISP") &
      acYear==theYear
    ) %>% 
    dplyr::select(
      acYear,
      LEA,
      school_code,
      subgroup,
      subject,
      num_tested,
      num_glp
    ) %>% 
    dplyr::group_by(
      acYear,
      school_code,
      subgroup,
      subject
    ) %>% 
    dplyr::summarise(
      tot_num_tested=sum(num_tested),
      tot_num_glp=sum(num_glp),
      tot_pct_glp=round(tot_num_glp*100/tot_num_tested,digits=1)
    ) %>%
    dplyr::filter(
      tot_pct_glp > 75
    ) %>%
    dplyr::ungroup()
  )
}

str(fn_dfDisagX20_345_best_X("D"))
```  

```{r fn_dfAnalyze_DisagX20_345_report}
# #########################################
#
# 
fn_dfAnalyze_DisagX20_345_report <- function(perYear) {
  # use fn_dfAnalyze.2_DisagX20_EDS_345 
  # returns schools with >= perYear instances >= 75%
  # occuring over nyears years
  #
  df_ <- 
    fn_dfAnalyze.2_DisagX20_EDS_345(perYear) %>%
    dplyr::inner_join(
      dfLEA %>%
      dplyr::select(
        LEA,
        District
      ),
      by="LEA"
    ) %>%
    dplyr::inner_join(
      df01TitleIYrD %>%
      dplyr::select(
        School.Code,
        School.Name,
        Charter.School,
        Total.Enrollment,
        Percent.Low.Income.Students,
        School.Served
      ),
      by=c("school_code"="School.Code")
    ) %>%
    dplyr::rename(
      school_name=School.Name,
      district=District,
      charter=Charter.School,
      total=Total.Enrollment,
      pct_EDS=Percent.Low.Income.Students,
      TitleI=School.Served
    ) %>%
    dplyr::mutate(
      pct_EDS=round(as.numeric(pct_EDS)),
      charter=ifelse(charter=="Y","Yes",""),
      TitleI=ifelse(TitleI=="Y","Yes",""),
      total=as.numeric(total)
    ) %>%
    dplyr::arrange(
      nyears,
      district,
      school_name
    ) %>%
    dplyr::select(
      nyears,
      district,
      school_name,
      school_code,
      total,
      pct_EDS,
      TitleI,
      charter
    ) 
  #
  return(df_)
  #
}
```  
